</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Dnieper

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Dnieper</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="diplomat.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="dominion.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (30%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To group all the cards into 4 sets of 13 cards in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> from King to Ace.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - move entire 13-card King to Ace <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> sequences from the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>7 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>, <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> from Ace to King as necessary.  Move groups of cards regardless of any sequence.  Fill spaces with any card.   At the start of the game 3 cards are dealt face down to each pile and one card is dealt is face up. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left) - deals one card to each <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a> </span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Any face up card in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> may be built upon another, no matter how deep it is in a pile.  All cards covering it are moved together.  When a face down card is uncovered, it is automatically turned face up and is available for play. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">Dnieper is a slightly easier variation of <a href="kiev.htm">Kiev</a>.</span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (middle) - build <a class="popuplink">up regardless of suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (top) - No building.  Top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.  Spaces are filled automatically from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  When the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> is empty, spaces may be filled by any card.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (bottom, face down) - move 1 card to <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Dominion is a variation of <a href="kingdom.htm">Kingdom</a>.</p>

</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (80%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>5 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build up or down regardless of suit, wrapping from Ace to King or King to Ace if needed, from the first card played to each pile.  Any number of cards may be played to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>5 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build up or down regardless of suit, wrapping from Ace to King or King to Ace if necessary.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> or in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Fill spaces with any card or legal group of cards.   At the start of the game 7 cards are dealt to each pile, alternating face up and face down.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (face down) - turn over cards one at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (beside <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Top card always available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Doorways is a game like <a href="single_interchange.htm">Single Interchange</a>.  It is deceptively easy, but the unusual <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> pile building can require care.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="single_interchange.htm">Single Interchange</a></p>
<p><a href="interchange.htm">Interchange</a></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Dorothy

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Dorothy</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="doorways.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="double_aces_and_kings.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Hard (8%).  All Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>12 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (right) - build top 4 piles <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> by twos starting with Tens (10,8,6,4,2), build the middle 4 piles <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> starting with Jacks (J,Q,K), and the bottom 4 piles <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> by twos starting with Nines (9,7,5,3,Ace).</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card to <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  One <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (below <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Double Aces and Kings

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Double Aces and Kings</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="dorothy.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="double_acme.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">4 Decks.  Medium (50%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>16 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (middle) - build the top 8 piles from Ace to King <a class="popuplink">up regardless of suit</a>, build the bottom 8 piles from Kings to Aces <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a>. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - storage spaces for cards.  Only one card allowed per pile.  Spaces are filled from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  When the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> is empty, spaces are filled by any card.  One card is dealt to each pile at the start of the game.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles (top) - Top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.  13 cards are dealt to each <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> at the start of the game.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (bottom left, face down) -  Turn over 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>It is allowed (in fact is it necessary in order to win)  to move cards from one <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> pile to another, in particular from Ace <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> to King <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> and vice versa. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Play consists of moving cards from the <a class="popuplink">reserves</a>, <a class="popuplink">waste</a>, and <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>, and especially in strategic movement of cards within the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> to allow more cards to be played there.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double Aces and Kings is a variation of <a href="aces_and_kings.htm">Aces and Kings</a> invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>. </p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="aces_and_kings.htm">Aces and Kings</a></p>
<p><a href="racing_aces.htm">Racing Aces</a></p>



</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Double Acme

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Double Acme</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a>

</span>
</td>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p>2 Decks.  Hard (20%)  Skill/luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Aces to Kings. At the beginning of the game the Aces are dealt here.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>5 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Spaces are filled from the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> if possible, then by any card.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time, by clicking.  1 <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Top card always available for play on the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> or <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> (left of <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>) - Top card always available for play on the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> or <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.  At the start of the game 19 cards are dealt here.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double A<span class="f_Format3">cme is a two deck version of <a href="acme.htm">Acme</a>.</span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">

<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Double Acquaintance</span></p>

<span style="font-size: 9pt">

</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p>2 Decks.  Medium (50%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top) - build <a class="popuplink">up regardless of suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - cards are dealt here from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  The top card of each pile is available for play.  Move cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> by clicking.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (face down) - deal 1 card to each <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> pile by clicking.  Two <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double Acquaintance is a two deck version of <a href="acquaintance.htm">Acquaintance</a>.</p>

# Double Alaska

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Double Alaska</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="double_acquaintance.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="double_australian.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Medium (70%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">up or down by suit</a>.  Move groups of cards regardless of any sequence.  Fill spaces with Kings or groups of cards headed by a King.   At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd pile, and so on.  The top card is face up.  Then 4 additional face up cards are dealt to the first pile and 5 additional cards dealt to each of the 2nd through 10th piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Any face up card in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> may be built upon another, no matter how deep it is in a pile.  All cards covering it are moved together.  When a face down card is uncovered, it is automatically turned face up and is available for play. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Uncover the face down cards as soon as possible.  Don't let one <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> get too far ahead of the others. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double Alaska is a 2 deck version of <a href="alaska.htm">Alaska</a>. </p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="alaska.htm">Alaska</a></p>

# Double Australian

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">

<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Double Australian</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">

</td>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Medium (25%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - Build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Groups of cards may be moved regardless of sequence. Spaces filled by Kings or groups of cards headed by a King. At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p>   </p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left) - turn over 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double Australian is a two deck version of <a href="australian_patience.htm">Australian Patience</a> with similarities to <a href="forty_thieves.htm">Forty Thieves</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Medium (40%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="text-indent: -6px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 6px;">To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>16 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (left and right) - build the left columns <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> starting with Aces, build the right columns <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> starting with Kings.  It does not matter where the two piles of the same suit meet.  At the start of the game the Aces are dealt to the left columns.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td> 16 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (in between <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">up or down by suit</a>.  Only one card at a time may be moved.  Spaces are not filled.  At the start of the game 6 cards are dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

# Double Canfield

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Double Canfield</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="double_bisley.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="double_dot.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Very Easy (99%).  Skill/luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from the <a class="popuplink">rank</a> of first card dealt to the first pile, <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> from King to Ace as necessary, until each pile contains 13 cards.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>5 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> on right) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Spaces are filled from the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> if possible, else by any card.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (left below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>, face down) - turn over 1 or 3 cards at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a>, by clicking.  Unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Top card always available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> (left of <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>, next to Waste) - Top card always available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.  At the start of the game 13 cards are dealt here.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p>Rules - selects whether 1 card or 3 cards at a time are turned over from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  (See options menu).</p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double Canfield is a two-deck version of the single deck game <a href="canfield.htm">Canfield</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>

<p><a href="quadruple_canfield.htm">Quadruple Canfield</a></p>
<p><a href="american_toad.htm">American Toad</a></p>
<p><a href="double_acme.htm">Double Acme</a></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p>1 Deck.  Easy (98%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> by Twos.  The first two piles start with Aces (Ace, 3,5,7,9,J,K,2,4,6,8,10,Q), the next 2 piles start with Twos (2,4,6,8,10,Q,A,3,5,7,9,J,K).  2 Aces and 2 Twos of different colors are dealt here at the start of the game.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a> by twos, <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> if necessary.  For example, a 6 can be played on an 8 or a Queen on an Ace.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a> by twos.  Spaces can be filled by any card or legal group of cards.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top right, face down) - Deals 1 card to each <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">cells</a> (around top left corner) - storage locations for cards.  Only 1 card allowed in each <a class="popuplink">cell</a>. At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each <a class="popuplink">cell</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>12 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> and <a class="popuplink">cells</a>) -  build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  The top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>, <a class="popuplink">cells</a>, or another <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> and if there are enough free <a class="popuplink">cells</a> that the cards could be moved individually.  Fill spaces with Kings or a group of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 8 cards are dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">Groups of cards in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> can only be moved as a group if there are a sufficient number of empty <a class="popuplink">cells</a> available to store the cards individually.  The ability to move cards as a group is only a shortcut to moving the group one card at a time.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">Try to keep as many <a class="popuplink">cells</a> empty as possible.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double Eight Off is a 2 deck version of <a href="eight_off.htm">Eight Off</a>.</p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Double Fives

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Double Fives</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="double_eight_off.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="double_fourteens.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 1px;">2 separate decks.  Very Easy (98%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from the <a class="popuplink">rank</a> of first card moved to the first pile, <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> from King to Ace as necessary, until each pile contains 13 cards. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">down in suit</a></span>.  Only the top card of each pile may be moved.  Spaces may be filled by any available card.  At the start of the game 5 cards are dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>2 <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles (top) - one of the two cards is moved to the first <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> pile to become the base.  The other card is then available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (bottom left, face down) - the first time through the deck deals 1 card to 5 <a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles clicking.  Each of the 5 cards are available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.  When the next set of 5 cards are dealt, any cards remaining in the 5 </span><a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles are moved out of play until the <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>.  One <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>.  The <a class="popuplink">redeal</a> collects all the unplayed cards from the first deal to form the new <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  After the <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>, clicking on the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> deals 1 card to a <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Before the <a class="popuplink">redeal</a> there are 5 piles, after the <a class="popuplink">redeal</a> there is one. Top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">Double Fives starts with 2 separate decks.  The first deck is dealt face up to the </span><a class="popuplink">tableau</a><span class="f_Format3"> (the two extra cards dealt to 2 </span><a class="popuplink">reserve</a><span class="f_Format3"> piles).  The other deck is dealt entirely to the </span><a class="popuplink">stock</a><span class="f_Format3">.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">Double Fives is an unusual variation of <a href="forty_thieves.htm">Forty Thieves</a>.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="forty_thieves.htm">Forty Thieves</a></span></p>
<p><a href="double_nickels.htm">Double Nickels</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Double Fourteens

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Double Fourteens</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="double_fives.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="double_freecell.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Easy (86%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To pair up all cards and move them out of play to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>18 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles - the top card of each pile is available.  Pair cards that total to 14.  For example, a King and an Ace, a Queen and a 2, or an 8 and a 6.  To remove a pair, pick up one card with the mouse and drop it on the other.  At the beginning of the game 6 cards are dealt to each of the first 16 piles, and 4 cards are dealt the remaining 2 piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile (far right) - where paired cards go out of play.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Cards that pair to 14: King-Ace, Queen-2, Jack-3, 10-4, 9-5, 8-6, 7-7.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double Fourteens is a two deck version of <a href="fourteen_out.htm">Fourteen Out</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="fourteen_out.htm">Fourteen Out</a></p>
<p><a href="triple_fourteens.htm">Triple Fourteens</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Double FreeCell

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Double FreeCell</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="double_fourteens.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="double_gold_rush.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p>2 Decks.  Easy (90%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King, <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> to Ace and then to King again, until each pile contains 26 cards.  At the beginning of the game an Ace of each suit is dealt here.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>6 <a class="popuplink">cells</a> (top left) - storage locations for cards.  Only 1 card allowed in each <a class="popuplink">cell</a>.  The card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> and <a class="popuplink">cells</a>) - The piles are built <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  The top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>, <a class="popuplink">cells</a>, or another <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a> and if there are enough free <a class="popuplink">cells</a> that the cards could be moved individually.  Fill spaces with Kings or legal groups of cards headed by a King (see <a href="king_only.htm">KingOnly</a> for variation).  At the start of the game 10 cards are dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><a href="king_only.htm">KingOnly</a>   <a>AutoPlay</a></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Note that groups of cards in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> can only be moved as a group if there are a sufficient number of empty <a class="popuplink">cells</a> available to store the cards individually.  The ability to move cards as a group is only a shortcut to moving the group one card at a time.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Try to keep as many <a class="popuplink">cells</a> empty as possible.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double FreeCell is a two-deck version of <a href="freecell.htm">FreeCell</a>.  It was invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="freecell.htm">FreeCell</a></p>
<p><a href="triple_freecell.htm">Triple FreeCell</a></p>

<p><a href="freecell_duplex.htm">FreeCell Duplex</a></p>
<p><a href="freecell_twice.htm">FreeCell Twice</a></p>
<p><a href="twenty_piles.htm">Twenty Piles</a></p>
<p><a href="quadruple_freecell.htm">Quadruple FreeCell</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Double Gold Rush

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Double Gold Rush</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p>2 Decks.  Easy (90%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Fill spaces with Kings or a group of cards headed by a King. <span class="f_Format3">At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.  The top card is face up.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (bottom left, face down) - turn over 3 cards at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking during the first deal, 2 cards at a time during the 2nd deal, and 1 card at a time during the last deal.  Two <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p>Double G<span class="f_Format3">old Rush is a 2 deck variation of <a href="gold_rush.htm">Gold Rush</a>.</span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">

</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">

<a href="double_jane.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Hard (10%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (across top) - no building.  Top card of each pile is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.  At the start of the game 7 cards are dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (face down below <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>) - turn over 1 card to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="text-indent: -24px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 36px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">up or down in sequence regardless of suit</a>.  No wraparound, only Twos can be played on Aces and nothing can be played on a King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">Play cards from the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> to the </span><a class="popuplink">waste</a> if possible.  Whenever there are no possible plays, turn over a card in the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> by clicking on it.  This card goes to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Work out your sequences in advance.  Be careful to save queens for kings, and twos for aces.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double Golf is a two deck variation of the classic game <a href="golf.htm">Golf</a>. </p>

<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>13 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Fill spaces with a King or group of cards headed by a King. <span class="f_Format3"> At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Top card always available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>9 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Fill spaces with Kings or a legal group of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 to the 2nd pile, and so on.  The top card is face up.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (bottom left, face down) - turn over 3 cards at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a>, by clicking.  Unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Top card always available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p>Double Minerva is a two deck version of <a href="minerva.htm">Minerva</a> invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="minerva.htm">Minerva</a></p>
<p><a href="triple_minerva.htm">Triple Minerva</a></p>




</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Double Moosehide

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Double Moosehide</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="double_minerva.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="double_nestor.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Medium (80%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down in any suit but the same</a>.  Move groups of cards regardless of any sequence.  Fill spaces with Kings or groups of cards headed by a King.   At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd pile, and so on.  The top card is face up.  Then 4 additional face up cards are dealt to the first pile and 5 additional cards dealt to each of the 2nd through 10th piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Any face up card in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> may be built upon another, no matter how deep it is in a pile.  All cards covering it are moved together.  When a face down card is uncovered, it is automatically turned face up and is available for play. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Uncover the face down cards as soon as possible.  Don't let one <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> get too far ahead of the others. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double Moosehide is a 2 deck version of <a href="moosehide.htm">Moosehide</a>. </p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="moosehide.htm">Moosehide</a></p>
<p><a href="doubleyukon.htm">Double Yukon</a></p>
<p><a href="yukon.htm">Yukon</a></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Medium (75%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To discard all the cards in pairs.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>12 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (across top) - the top card is available for play.  Pair up cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.  At the start of the game 8 cards are dealt face up to each pile. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 extra cards (below <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>) - each card is available for play to be paired with cards in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Double Nestor is a 2 deck version of <a href="nestor.htm">Nestor</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="nestor.htm">Nestor</a></p>
