<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Easy (85%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top)  - build the first 4 piles <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King (one for each suit), the last 4 <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> from King to Ace (one for each suit).</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>12 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> only. Each pile may contain up to 2 cards.  Any card may be played on the first card.  Spaces may be filled from the <a class="popuplink">waste</a>.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (left, face down) - Turn over 1 card to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  One <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (below <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Father is a more difficult but more strategic version of <a href="grandfather.htm">Grandfather</a> invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>.</p>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck. Medium (50%).  Skill/Luck Balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td> 15 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles  - build cards whose <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> add to 15,of different suits.  Aces can be played on any card of different suit.  Aces can be played on Aces, but no other card can be played on an Ace. Only one card at a time may be moved.  Spaces are filled automatically from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face up) - automatically fills spaces in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.  Top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">The idea is to get all of the cards in play by grouping cards in piles.  Allowable plays are 2-K, 3-Q, 4-J, 5-10, 6-9, 7-8, and Ace on any card and A-A.  All plays must be of different suits.  The game is won if all cards are moved from the </span><a class="popuplink">stock</a><span class="f_Format3"> onto the </span><a class="popuplink">tableau</a><span class="f_Format3">. </span></p>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (80%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To pair up all cards and move them out of play to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>3 triangular peaks of cards and 8 piles of 3 cards each - the top card of each pile is available Only uncovered cards in the peaks are available for play.  Pair cards whose <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> total to 15, and pair Aces.   To remove a pair, pick up one card with the mouse and drop it on the other.  At the start of the game 28 cards are dealt face up to the 3 triangular peaks and 3 cards are dealt face up to the 8 piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="text-indent: -24px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 36px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile - where paired cards go out of play.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<p>Cards that pair to 15: King--2, Queen-3, Jack-4, 10-5, 9-6, 8-7, Ace-Ace.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="fourteen_peaks.htm">Fourteen Peaks</a></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Fifteen Puzzle

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Fifteen Puzzle</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="fifteen_peaks.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="fifteen_puzzle_cell.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (80%).  Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move all the cards of each <a class="popuplink">rank</a> to the same pile, so that there are 13 piles of 4 cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>15 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (2 begin empty) - Cards may be played on other cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.  At most 4 cards are allowed in any pile.  Empty piles may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt face up to 13 of the piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Cards may be played on other cards of the same rank.  For example, if the top card of a pile is a Three, another Three can be played on top of it.  The object is to move the cards so that there are 13 piles of 4 cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>, that is, one pile of 4 Kings, one pile of 4 Queens, and so on.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>This game is named after a small plastic game consisting of numbers that slid around.  The numbers would be all jumbled up and the object was to put them in order.  This game is sort of a card game version of that game, which was very popular 30-40 years ago.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="yukon_puzzle.htm">Yukon Puzzle</a></p>
<p><a href="fifteen_puzzle_cell.htm">Fifteen Puzzle Cell</a></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move all the cards of each <a class="popuplink">rank</a> to the same pile, so that there are 13 piles of 4 cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>15 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (2 begin empty) - Cards may be played on other cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.  At most 4 cards are allowed in any pile.  Empty piles may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt face up to 13 of the piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>1 <a class="popuplink">cell</a> (top center) - storage locations for cards.  Only 1 card allowed in the <a class="popuplink">cell</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Cards may be played on other cards of the same rank.  For example, if the top card of a pile is a Three, another Three can be played on top of it.  The object is to move the cards so that there are 13 piles of 4 cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>, that is, one pile of 4 Kings, one pile of 4 Queens, and so on.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Fifteen Puzzle Cell is the game <a href="fifteen_puzzle.htm">Fifteen Puzzle</a> with a <a class="popuplink">cell</a>.</p>

# Fifteen Rush

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Fifteen Rush</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Easy (85%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To discard all the cards.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>7 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles - the top card is available for play.  Discard pairs of cards that have <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> that add to 15. Possible pairs are King-2, Queen-3, Jack-4, 10-5, 9-6, 8-7.  Aces are paired together (Ace-Ace). <span class="f_Format3">Spaces are filled from the </span><a class="popuplink">stock</a><span class="f_Format3">, or the top card of the </span><a class="popuplink">waste</a><span class="f_Format3"> if the </span><a class="popuplink">stock</a><span class="f_Format3"> is empty.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.  The top card is face up.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over  3 cards at a time, by clicking.  Unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for pairing.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Valid Discards</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>A-A, 2-K, 3-Q, 4-J, 5-10, 6-9, 7-8</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Fifteen <span class="f_Format3">Rush is an addition game like <a href="fifteens.htm">Fifteens</a> with a tableau like <a href="klondike.htm">Klondike</a>.  It was invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>.</span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Fifteens

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Fifteens</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a>

<a href="fifteens_suit.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Easy (95%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To discard all the cards.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>16 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles - the top card is available for play.  Discard sets of cards that have <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> that add to 15. Tens, Jacks, Queens, and Kings are discarded as a set (10-J-Q-K).  Spaces are automatically filled from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.   To discard a set of cards, move each card to the reserve pile in the lower left.  When a 10-J-Q-K set is formed, or when cards of <a class="popuplink">rank</a> 9 or under add to 15, the cards are automatically discarded to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.   Any number of cards of <a class="popuplink">rank</a> 9 or under can be used to make a set that adds to 15.  As a shortcut, pairs of cards that add to 15 (9-6, 8-7) can be discarded by dropping one on the other.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (face down, left) - fills spaces in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (far right)  - Where paired cards go out of play.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a><span class="f_Format3"> (lower left) - where sets of cards are formed.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Valid Discards</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10-Jack-Queen-King, any number of cards of <a class="popuplink">rank</a> 9 or less that add to 15</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Fifteens<span class="f_Format3"> is a classic game of addition.</span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Hard (5%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To discard all the cards.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>16 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles - the top card is available for play.  Discard sets of cards that have <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> that add to 15 and are of the same suit. Tens, Jacks, Queens, and Kings are discarded as a set of the same  suit(10-J-Q-K).  Spaces are automatically filled from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.   To discard a set of cards, move each card to the reserve pile in the lower left.  When a 10-J-Q-K suit set is formed, or when cards of <a class="popuplink">rank</a> 9 or under add to 15, the cards are automatically discarded to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.   Any number of cards of <a class="popuplink">rank</a> 9 or under of the same suit can be used to make a set that adds to 15.  As a shortcut, pairs of cards that add to 15 of the same suit (9-6, 8-7) can be discarded by dropping one on the other.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (face down, left) - fills spaces in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (far right)  - Where paired cards go out of play.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a><span class="f_Format3"> (lower left) - where sets of cards are formed.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Valid Discards</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10-Jack-Queen-King of the same suit, any number of cards of <a class="popuplink">rank</a> 9 or less that add to 15 of the same suit</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Fifteens Suit is a much harder version of <a href="fifteens.htm">Fifteens</a>.</p>

# Fifty Bandits

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Fifty Bandits</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="fifteens_suit.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="firing_squad.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Medium (20%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Move groups of cards only if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>. Spaces may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 5 cards are dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (bottom left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.  All cards in the waste are visible.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Try to get a space in the tableau as quickly as possible. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Fifty Bandits is a variation of <a href="famous_fifty.htm">Famous Fifty</a> where groups of cards in sequence may be moved, making it a slightly easier game. </p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="forty_thieves.htm">Forty Thieves</a></p>
<p><a href="famous_fifty.htm">Famous Fifty</a></p>
<p><a href="forty_bandits.htm">Forty Bandits</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Firing Squad

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Firing Squad</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="fifty_bandits.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="five_and_diamond.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Hard (15%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To remove all the cards from the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> except the 4 Aces.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (top) - cards are dealt here 1 to each pile from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  The top card of each pile is available for play.  Any top card that is of lower <a class="popuplink">rank</a> and the same <a class="popuplink">suit</a> of another top card may be removed by clicking on it. Aces are considered to be of the highest <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.  Spaces may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">1 <a class="popuplink">cell</a> (right of </span><a class="popuplink">tableau</a>) <span class="f_Format3">- storage location for one card.  Once a card is moved here it can only be moved back to an empty </span><a class="popuplink">tableau</a><span class="f_Format3"> pile.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (face down) - deal 1 card to each <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">Play consists of removing all but the highest <a class="popuplink">rank</a> exposed card of each <a class="popuplink">suit</a>.  The only way to get at cards beneath an Ace is to move the Ace to an empty pile.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>You cannot use the suit of a card in the <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">cell</a></span> to remove a card from the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.  Once a card is moved to the <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">cell</a></span>, it is essentially a dead card until it can be moved back into an empty <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Firing Squad is a variation of <a href="aces_up.htm">Aces Up</a>. It has an additional <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">cell</a></span><span style="font-weight: bold;"> </span>which makes the game easier and adds strategy.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="aces_up.htm">Aces Up</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Five and Diamond

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Five and Diamond</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="firing_squad.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="five_little_guys.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Hard (11%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right, arranged in a diamond shape) - build <a class="popuplink">up in color</a> from the <a class="popuplink">rank</a> of first card dealt to the first pile, <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> from King to Ace as necessary, until each pile contains 13 cards.  At the start of the game a card is dealt to the first pile (top).   The <a class="popuplink">base</a> cards for the other three (empty) piles will alternate colors and skip numbers until all four suits are represented.  For example, if the first card dealt is the 4 <span style="font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #ff0000;">♦</span>, a black 6 must be played on the left pile, the 8 <span style="font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #ff0000;">♥</span> played on the bottom pile, and a black 10 of the black suit different from the suit of the 6 played on the right pile. <a class="popuplink">Base</a> cards may be played in any order (for example, in the above scenario, the 10 <span style="font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial';">♠/♣</span> may be played BEFORE the 6 of <span style="font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial';">♣/♠</span> or the 8 <span style="font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #ff0000;">♥</span>).</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="text-indent: -24px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 36px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>5 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (left) - Build down by twos in alternate color (i.e. a 3 <span style="font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial';">♠</span> could be played on a 5 <span style="font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #ff0000;">♦</span>,  or a Queen <span style="font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #ff0000;">♥</span> on a Ace <span style="font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial';">♣</span>), <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> from Ace to King as necessary.  Groups of cards may be moved if they are in sequence. Spaces may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 3 cards are dealt to each pile, 2 face down and 1 face up.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over one card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card always available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 12px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p style="text-indent: -12px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 12px;">Five and Diamond is a variation on <a href="canfield.htm">Canfield</a> invented by <a href="alex_bove.htm">Alex Bove</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="canfield.htm">Canfield</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Five Little Guys

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Five Little Guys</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="five_and_diamond.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="five_piles.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Hard (10%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (middle) - build the first 4 piles from Ace to King <a class="popuplink">up regardless of suit</a>, build the last 4 piles from Kings to Aces <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a>. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>5 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>, on right) - storage spaces for cards.  Only one card allowed per pile.  Spaces are filled from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  When the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> is empty, spaces are filled by any card.  One card is dealt to each pile at the start of the game.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>2 <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles (top) - Top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.  14 cards are dealt to each <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> at the start of the game.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (bottom left, face down) -  Turn over 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>  It is allowed (in fact is it necessary in order to win)  to move cards from one <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> pile to another, in particular from Ace <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> to King <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> and vice versa. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Play consists of moving cards from the <a class="popuplink">reserves</a>, <a class="popuplink">waste</a>, and <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>, and especially in strategic movement of cards within the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> to allow more cards to be played there.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Five Little Guys is a variation of <a href="aces_and_kings.htm">Aces and Kings</a> invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>. </p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="aces_and_kings.htm">Aces and Kings</a></p>



</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Five Piles

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Five Piles</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="five_little_guys.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="five_pirates.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Hard (4%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To pair up all cards and move them out of play.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>5 Piles (surprise!) - discard pairs of cards that add to 13, Kings singly.  The top card of each pile is available.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (far right, face down) - clicking deals 1 card to each of the 5 piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Any pair of cards whose values add to 13 can be discarded.  The valid pairs are Queen-Ace, Jack-Two, 10-3, 9-4, 8-5, 7-6.  Kings are discarded singly.  To discards Kings, simply click on them.  When all possible pairs are discarded, deal another set of 5 cards onto the piles by clicking on the Stock.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>The last 2 cards in the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> form their own piles and can be discarded with cards from any of the 5 piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>The game will inform you if you win, or if you have no more possible moves.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>5 Piles is an easy game to play, but fairly difficult to win.  It is also known as Baroness.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="thirteens.htm">Thirteens</a></p>
<p><a href="pyramid.htm">Pyramid</a></p>
<p><a href="five_stacks.htm">Five Stacks</a></p>
<p><a href="seven_piles.htm">Seven Piles</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Five Pirates

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Five Pirates</span></p>
</td>
<td>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Medium (30%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Only one card at a time may be moved. Spaces may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (bottom left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time to each <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>5 <a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card of each pile is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">Five Pirates is a variation of <a href="forty_thieves.htm">Forty Thieves</a> with 5 </span><a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles.</p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Five Stacks

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">

</span>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (80%).  Skill/Luck Balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To pair up all the cards in the deck in pairs of cards whose <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> total to 13.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>5 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles - Discard pairs of cards whose <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> add to 13.  Kings are discarded singly.  To discard a pair, drop one card on the other, or right-click on one of the cards.   At the start of the game 8 cards are dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) -  turn over cards one to each <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile by clicking.  Unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a>  (beside <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - The top card is available for play. Discard pairs of cards whose <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> add to 13.  Kings are discarded singly.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Any pair of cards whose values add to 13 can be discarded.  The valid pairs are Queen-Ace, Jack-Two, 10-3, 9-4, 8-5, 7-6.  Kings are discarded singly.  To discards Kings, simply click on them. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Five Stacks is a variation of <a href="nile.htm">Nile</a> and <a href="five_piles.htm">Five Piles</a>.</p>

<p><a href="five_piles.htm">Five Piles</a></p>
<p><a href="pyramid.htm">Pyramid</a></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to Queen.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">King </span><a class="popuplink">foundation</a> (left under other <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - move all Kings to this pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>6 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a>.  One card at a time may be moved. Spaces may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 6 cards are dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (below <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

# Flow

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Flow</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="floradora.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="flower_garden.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Easy  (95%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To group all the cards into 4 sets of 13 cards in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> from King to Ace within the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (top) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Spaces can be filled by any card or legal group of cards.  A<span class="f_Format3">t the start of the game these piles are empty.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Cards are available for play on the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> (a group of cards that is in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> may also be moved as a group to the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>).  Spaces can be filled by any single card.   At the start of the game 6 cards are dealt to each pile (the first 4 piles are dealt 7).</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">Play consists of moving cards from the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles to the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> in order to form 4 sequences <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> from King to Ace.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">Try to begin by concentrating on grouping cards of one or two suits together.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">Flow is an easier variation of <a href="wave_motion.htm">Wave Motion</a>.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="wave_motion.htm">Wave Motion</a></span></p>

<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="freecell.htm">FreeCell</a></span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="scorpion.htm">Scorpion</a></span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>6 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> "Garden" piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a>.  Only one card at a time may be moved.  Spaces are filled by any card.  At the start of the game 6 cards are dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> "Bouquet" (left) - All cards available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.  Click on card to move it to the bottom of the stack, then move to either the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.   At the start of the game 16 cards are dealt to this pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Medium (25%).  Skill/luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up regardless of suit</a> from Ace to King.  At the start of the game the Aces are dealt here.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> (far left, below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> only.  At the start of the game 13 cards are dealt here.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">reserve</a>) - Top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>5 <a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles (right of <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - can contain any cards.   You can build cards only from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  Top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> only.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="auto_play.htm">AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<p>On the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles, you should try to build downward, if possible.  One pile should be reserved for Kings and Queens.  Don't put lots of cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a> in the same pile.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>F<span class="f_Format3">ly is a variation of <a href="frog.htm">Frog</a>.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="gnat.htm">Gnat</a></p>
<p><a href="housefly.htm">Housefly</a></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="frog.htm">Frog</a></span></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# ForeCell

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">ForeCell</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="fly.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="forsythia.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (60%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">cells</a> (top left) - storage locations for cards.  Only 1 card allowed in each <a class="popuplink">cell</a>.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> and <a class="popuplink">cells</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a> and <span class="f_Format3">if there are enough free <a class="popuplink">cells</a> that the cards could be moved individually.</span>  Spaces can be filled only by Kings or a group of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 6 cards are dealt face up to the each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Groups of cards in the <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span> can only be moved as a group if there are a sufficient number of empty <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">cells</a></span> available to store the cards individually.  The ability to move cards as a group is only a shortcut to moving the group one card at a time.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">The game number deals #1 to #1000000 are compatible with the games in the standard Windows FreeCell.  For more information about FreeCell type games, see </span><span style="color: #0000ff;"><a class="weblink" href="http://www.freecell.org">http://www.freecell.org</a>. </span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">Try to keep as many <a class="popuplink">cells</a> empty as possible.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>ForeCell is a <span class="f_Format3">predecessor</span> to <a href="freecell.htm">FreeCell</a>.   It appeared in a 1945 Swedish book <span style="font-style: italic;">Världens bästa patienser och patiensspel </span><span class="f_Format3">by Einar Werner.  It was called Napoleon in St. Helena.  Since this is a very common name for a solitaire game, the name was changed here to ForeCell to emphasize it's relationship to </span><a href="freecell.htm">FreeCell</a><span class="f_Format3">.   The differences between ForeCell and </span><a href="freecell.htm">FreeCell</a><span class="f_Format3"> are that 4 cards are dealt to the </span><a class="popuplink">cells</a><span class="f_Format3"> rather than the </span><a class="popuplink">tableau</a><span class="f_Format3">, and only Kings can fill empty spaces in the the </span><a class="popuplink">tableau</a><span class="f_Format3">.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="freecell.htm">FreeCell</a></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="bakers_game.htm">Baker's Game</a></span></p>
<p><a href="blind_freecell.htm">Blind FreeCell</a></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Medium (50%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Aces to Kings.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a> from the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile only.  Spaces may be filled by any card from the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile only.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (bottom, face down on left) - move 1 card to <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  One <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (beside <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>


</td></tr></tbody></table>
