</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Kings in the Corners

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Kings in the Corners</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="kings_and_queens.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="kings_way.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Easy (80%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To place all the Kings, Queens, and Jacks in their places.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>16 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles - the four corners are for Kings, top and bottom are for Queens, left and right are for Jacks.  Pair cards that add to 10 (after the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a><span class="f_Format3"> is filled).</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (face down, left) - top card is available for play in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (far right)  - Where paired cards go out of play.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Valid Discards</span></p>
<p>Ace-9, 2-8, 3-7, 4-6, 5-5, Tens singly.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Play</span></p>
<p>Play by moving the top card of the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> to an empty pile in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.  The object is the place the Kings in the piles marked for Kings in the corners, Queens in the piles marked for Queens, and Jacks in the piles marked for Jacks.  Any card (except Kings, Queens, or Jacks) may be played to the other piles. </p>

<p>Cards are to be placed in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> and the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> must be completely filled before cards can be removed in pairs.</p>

<p>Two cards that add to 10 may be paired and removed from play (Tens are removed singly).  Cards other than the King, Queen, or Jack may be placed in the edge piles, but you will need to remove them in a pair so that a King, Queen, or Jack can later be played there.  Once a card has been placed, it cannot be moved except to create a pair that adds to 10 (Tens are removed by themselves).</p>

<p>When all possible pairs have been removed, fill the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> again from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  When the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> is once again filled, cards can be paired once again. </p>

<p>Repeat the process. The game is won if the 12 Kings, Queens, and Jacks are all placed in their proper places.  The game is lost if a King, Queen, or Jack appears and there is no proper place to put it, or if the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> fills up and there are no pairs to remove.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<p>Place Kings, Queens, and Jacks in their marked places when they appear (you cannot place them on any other pile)  Fill the center first with lower cards, pairing out cards that add to 10 when possible.  When the center is full, you will need to place lower cards on the spaces for Kings, Queens, and Jacks.  Fill up places where there are the most other options available (for example, if there are 3 empty King spaces but only two empty Queen and Jack spaces, fill the King space first).   Note that you will always be able to remove a 10 once the </p>
<p><a class="popuplink">tableau</a> is filled.</p>

<p>Once the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> is filled, try to pair off the blocking low cards as quickly as possible as if a King, Queen, or Jack is needed for that space and there are no other places to put them, you will lose.  When all possible pairs have been removed, fill the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> again and then remove pairs again.</p>


</td></tr></tbody></table>

# King's Way

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">King's Way</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="kings_in_the_corners.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="kingsdown_eights.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Hard (17%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move all the cards except Kings in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> and Aces in the <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">reserve</a></span> to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (across top) - no building.  Top card of each pile is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.  At the start of the game the Kings are dealt here, then a row of face down cards, then 4 face up cards are dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (face down below <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>) - turn over 1 card to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  1 <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">redeal</a>.  In the <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>, the number of Aces in the </span><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> is counted and that number of cards are taken from the bottom of the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> to form a new <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="text-indent: -24px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 36px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">up or down by alternate color</a>.  No wraparound, only Twos can be played on Aces and only Jacks can be played on Queens.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> (below <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Any Ace dealt to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> can be played here.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">Play cards from the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> to the </span><a class="popuplink">waste</a> if possible.  Whenever there are no possible plays, turn over a card in the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> by clicking on it.  This card goes to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>The game is won if the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> is cleared except for Kings. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">The </span><a class="popuplink">redeal</a> only<span style="font-weight: bold;"> </span>redeals the number of cards in the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a>.  It is important to place as many Aces in the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> as possible, however it may be necessary to leave some Aces in the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> in order to play Twos on them. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>King's Way is a 2 deck varation of <a href="golf.htm">Golf</a>. </p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="golf.htm">Golf</a></p>
<p><a href="putt_putt.htm">Putt Putt</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Hard (11%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (left) - build the piles <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (across top) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or another <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile.  Build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Only one card at a time may be moved.  Spaces may be filled by any available card.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.  No building.  Spaces are not filled except by the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> (when the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> is clicked).  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - clicking deals 4 cards to each <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> pile.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Kingsdown Eights is a variation of <a href="tournament.htm">Tournament</a> and <a href="cicely.htm">Cicely</a>.</p>

<p>1 Deck.  Hard (1%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> from King to Ace.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>7 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">up by alternate color</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">up by alternate color</a>.  Fill spaces with Aces or groups of cards with an Ace at the bottom. <span class="f_Format3"> At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.  The top card is face up.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time, by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>

# King of Egypt

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">

<td>

</td>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Medium (35%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Groups of cards in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> may be moved as a unit.  Spaces may be filled only by Kings.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 3 to the 2nd, 5 to the 3rd, 7 to the 4th, 9 to the 5th, 10 to the 6th, 8 to the 7th, 6 to the 8th, 4 to the 9th, and 2 to the 10th.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  One <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">King of Egypt is a harder version of <a href="thieves_of_egypt.htm">Thieves of Egypt</a></span>.  Like<span class="f_Format3"> <a href="thieves_of_egypt.htm">Thieves of Egypt</a></span> it was invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>.</p>

# King Tut

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">King Tut</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="king_of_egypt.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="kleine_napoleon.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Very Hard (3%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To clear the pyramid by pairing up all the cards in the pyramid.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>A Pyramid of 28 cards.  Only uncovered cards are available for play.  Discard pairs of cards whose <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> add to 13.  Kings are discarded singly.  To discard a pair, drop one card on the other, or right-click on one of the cards.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left) - turn over cards 3 at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  Unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (beside <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - The top card is available for play.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Any pair of cards whose values add to 13 can be discarded.  The valid pairs are Queen-Ace, Jack-Two, 10-3, 9-4, 8-5, 7-6.  Kings are discarded singly.  To discards Kings, simply click on them. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>This is a variation of <a href="pyramid.htm">Pyramid</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>

<p><a href="pharaohs.htm">Pharaohs</a></p>
<p><a href="pyramid_golf.htm">Pyramid Golf</a></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Kleine Napoleon

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Kleine Napoleon</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="king_tut.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="klondike.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Very Easy (98%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (center) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> or <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> from the <a class="popuplink">rank</a> of first card dealt to each pile, <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> from King to Ace or Ace to King as necessary, until each pile contains 13 cards.  At the start of the game 4 cards of a random <a class="popuplink">rank</a> are dealt here.  The first card played to any of these piles determines whether building is <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> or <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Once the direction of building has been established all 4 piles are built in the same direction and it cannot be changed.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (left and right) - build <a class="popuplink">up or down regardless of suit</a>.  Top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>, <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>, or <a class="popuplink">reserve</a>.  Only one card at a time may be moved.  Spaces are filled by any available card, including from the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a>.  At the start of the game 5 cards are dealt face up to each pile, except the bottom 2 piles which are dealt 4 cards.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> (center, below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - storage location for cards.  Any number of cards may be played here from the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>, however the top card is available for play only on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or any empty <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile.  Cards in the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> cannot be played to non-empty <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Kleine Napoleon is of German origin.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="napoleon.htm">Napoleon</a></p>
<p><a href="beleaguered_castle.htm">Beleaguered Castle</a></p>
<p><a href="zerline.htm">Zerline</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Klondike

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Klondike</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="kleine_napoleon.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="klondike_13.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p>1 Deck.  Medium (80%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>7 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Fill spaces with Kings or groups of cards with a King at the bottom. (See <span class="f_Format3"><a>KingOnly</a> for option).  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.  The top card is face up.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 1 or 3 cards (see rules below) at a time, by clicking.  Unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p>Rules - selects whether 1 card or 3 cards at a time are turned over from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>. (See Options menu)</p>

<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>KingOnly</a>   <a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Klondike is basic Windows solitaire (the game that comes with Windows).  It probably dates back to the Klondike gold rush of the late 19th century.  It is known by many names, including Chinaman, Fascination, Triangle, Patience, and Solitaire.  In England it is often called Canfield.  This version is actually a variation of the real Klondike, which does not allow redeals.</p>

<p><span class="f_Format3">The earliest known reference to Klondike under this name appears in the 1914 book </span><a href="lady_cadogans.htm">Lady Cadogan's Illustrated Games of Solitaire or Patience</a><span class="f_Format3">.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>

<p><a href="steps.htm">Steps</a></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="yukon.htm">Yukon</a></span></p>
<p><a href="triangular.htm">Triangular</a></p>
<p><a href="small_triangle.htm">Small Triangle</a></p>
<p><a href="klondike_deal_2.htm">Klondike Deal 2</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Easy (85%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To discard all the cards.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>7 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles - the top card is available for play.  Discard pairs of cards that have <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> that add to 13. Possible pairs are Queen-Ace, Jack-Two, 10-3, 9-4, 8-5, 7-6.  Kings are discarded singly. <span class="f_Format3">Spaces are filled from the </span><a class="popuplink">stock</a><span class="f_Format3">, or the top card of the </span><a class="popuplink">waste</a><span class="f_Format3"> if the </span><a class="popuplink">stock</a><span class="f_Format3"> is empty.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.  The top card is face up.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over  3 cards at a time, by clicking.  Unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for pairing.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Valid Discards</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Queen-Ace, Jack-Two, 10-3, 9-4, 8-5, 7-6, King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">Klondike 13 is an addition game like <a href="pyramid.htm">Pyramid</a> with a tableau like <a href="klondike.htm">Klondike</a>. </span></p>

</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p>1 Deck.  Medium (75%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Fill spaces with Kings or groups of cards with a King at the bottom.<span class="f_Format3">  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.  The top card is face up.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time, by clicking.  2 <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Klondike Mini is a 4 pile version of <a href="klondike.htm">Klondike</a>.</p>

# Klondike Puzzle

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Klondike Puzzle</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="klondike_mini.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="klondike_territory.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p>2 Decks.  Very Easy (95%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move one deck of cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>, to move the other deck of cards into 13 piles of 4 cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>7 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Fill spaces with Kings or groups of cards with a King at the bottom. <span class="f_Format3"> At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.  The top card is face up.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>13 <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles (on right) - Cards may be played on other cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.  At most 4 cards are allowed in any pile.  Empty piles may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 3 cards at a time, by clicking.  Unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">In the </span><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles, cards may be played on other cards of the same rank.  For example, if the top card of a pile is a Three, another Three can be played on top of it.  The object is to move the cards so that there are 13 piles of 4 cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>, that is, one pile of 4 Kings, one pile of 4 Queens, and so on.  Note that the 4 cards must all be of different suits.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Klondike Puzzle is a combination of the games <a href="klondike.htm">Klondike</a> and <a href="fifteen_puzzle.htm">Fifteen Puzzle</a>.  It was invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>

<p><a href="fifteen_puzzle.htm">Fifteen Puzzle</a></p>
<p><a href="yukon_puzzle.htm">Yukon Puzzle</a></p>
<p><a href="interchange_puzzle.htm">Interchange Puzzle</a></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Klondike Territory

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Klondike Territory</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="klondike_puzzle.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="klondike_twice.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>

</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (30%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>7 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Spaces can be filled with Kings or groups of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.  The top card is face up.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> pile (top left) - All cards available for play.  Click on a card to move it to the bottom of the stack, then move to either the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.  At the start of the game 24 cards are dealt face up to this pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a> </span></p>

<p><span class="f_Format3">Notes</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">To move a card from the </span><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> pile, click on a card to move it to the bottom of the stack, then move the card to where you want to play it.  You can also right click on a card in the stack and if there is a legal move for the card the game will make that move.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Klondike Territory is a variation of <a href="northwest_territory.htm">Northwest Territory</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>

<p><a href="klondike.htm">Klondike</a></p>
<p><a href="flower_garden.htm">Flower Garden</a></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Easy (80%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>7 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Groups of cards in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a> may be moved.  Spaces are filled by a King or legal group of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.  The top card is face up.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turns over 3 cards at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  Unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (below <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Klondike Twice is a two deck variation of <a href="klondike.htm">Klondike</a> suggested by Bastiko Pradhana. </p>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck. Medium (60%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To pair up all the cards in the deck in pairs of cards of the same <a class="popuplink">ranks</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">tableau</a> (center) - Pair up cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>. At the start of the game 36 cards are dealt out in an 6x6 square, with every other card rotated 90 degrees.  Only cards which have a short side not blocked by another card are available.  In the initial configuration, 12 of the cards on the outside edge are available.  As cards are removed, interior cards will become available.  Available cards from the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> or <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> can be paired. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles - No building, the top card is available for pairing with the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> .  Two cards from the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles cannot be paired.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="text-indent: -13px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 13px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<p style="text-indent: -13px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 13px;"><span style="font-weight: bold; color: #000000;">History</span></p>
<p style="text-indent: -13px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 13px;"><span style="color: #000000;">Knitting Pairs is an Addition type version of the game </span><a href="crazy_quilt.htm">Crazy Quilt</a> based on an idea by Bastiko Pradhana.</p>
<p style="text-indent: -13px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 13px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<p style="text-indent: -13px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 13px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Knotty Nines

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Knotty Nines</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="kinitting_pairs.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="l.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck. Very Hard (&lt;1%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>9 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles  - build <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a>.  Only one card at a time may be moved.  Spaces are filled automatically from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (left, face down) - automatically fills spaces in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">The idea is to get all of the cards in play by grouping cards in piles </span><a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a><span class="f_Format3">, which brings more cards into play via the empty spaces created.  The game is won if all cards are moved from the </span><a class="popuplink">stock</a><span class="f_Format3"> onto the </span><a class="popuplink">tableau</a><span class="f_Format3">.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">Knotty Nines is a harder variation of <a href="trusty_twelve.htm">Trusty Twelve</a>.</span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

# La Belle Lucie

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (40%).  Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>18 <a class="popuplink">fans</a> (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Only one card at a time may be moved.  Spaces are not filled.  At the start of the game 3 cards are dealt face up to each pile (except for the last pile, which just has 1 card).</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 3px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (upper left, no cards) -  There are two <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.  After all possible plays have been made, redeal by clicking on the green arrow in the upper left corner.  All the cards in the fans are reshuffled. The <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> remain.  2 <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>There are two ways to move cards between <a class="popuplink">fans</a>, depending on the settings under Rules in the Options menu.  If Drag and Drop is set, the cards are dragged with the mouse.  If Click is set, clicking on a card in a <a class="popuplink">fan</a> automatically moves it to the one other <a class="popuplink">fan</a> that it can move to.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 3px;">This game is tough.  Once you move a card onto a <a class="popuplink">fan</a>, the cards below are blocked until a <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>, unless they can be played to a <a class="popuplink">foundation</a>.  Kings block all cards below them as well.  Play cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> when they are available.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">La Belle Lucie is a classic variation of <a href="fan.htm">Fan</a>. </span></p>

<p><a href="linus.htm">Linus</a></p>
<p><a href="three_shuffles_and_a_cell.htm">Three Shuffles and a Cell</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# La Nivernaise

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">La Nivernaise</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="la_belle_lucie.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="ladies_battle.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Hard (5%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top) - build the piles on the left <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King, build the piles on the right <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> from King to Ace.  Each group of 4 piles should have a pile of each suit. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>6 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (face up in the middle) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">reserves</a>.  Spaces are filled by a group of 4 cards from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  No building.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile, only the top card is visible.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles (left and right sides) - each pile can contain 1 card from the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>, available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top, face down) - clicking deals 4 cards to each <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile.  There are 2 <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.  (During a <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">redeal</a> all the cards in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> are collected and all the cards are redealt to the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 12px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">When the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> piles of the same suit meet, is its allowable (and encouraged) to move cards from one <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> to the other.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<p>Try to keep at least one <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> open.  Don't put cards on the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> that will stay there for a long time.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>La Nivernaise is an older version of <a href="tournament.htm">Tournament</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="tournament.htm">Tournament</a></p>
<p><a href="kingsdown_eights.htm">Kingsdown Eights</a></p>
<p><a href="cicely.htm">Cicely</a></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>6 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (across) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  One card at a time may be moved. Spaces are filled automatically from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - deals 1 card to each <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile by clicking.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4<span style="font-weight: bold;"> </span>Jacks (far left) - available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> only<span style="font-weight: bold;">.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>

# Lady Betty

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Lady Betty</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a>

</td>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (70%).  Skill/luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>6 <a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - cards are played here from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  The top card of each pile is available for play.  Move cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> by clicking.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (far left, below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - Top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles or <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Lady Betty is a variation of <a href="sir_tommy.htm">Sir Tommy</a>.</p>

# Lady Cadogan

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Lady Cadogan</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="lady_betty.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="lady_jane.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Very Easy (90%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build left 4 piles <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King,  drop 13 card sequences of same suit cards from the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> on the right 4 piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a>.  Groups of cards in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> may be moved as a unit. S<span class="f_Format3">paces are filled by Kings or legal groups of cards headed by a King (see </span><a>KingOnly</a> for option).  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd pile, and so on.  The top card is face up.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - deal 1 card to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile by clicking.  Unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (right of <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>KingOnly</a>   <a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>The first 4 <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> are built <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King (using any suits for the 4 piles).   The last 4 <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> are built in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.  Build 4 13-card sequences of same suit, from King down to Ace.  To move these cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>, pick up the entire 13-card sequence and drop it on the desired <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> pile.   Single cards are not allowed in these <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Lady Cadogan is a variation of <a href="rouge_et_noir.htm">Rouge et Noir</a> invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>.  It is named after Lady Adelaide Cadogan, who published one of the first books on solitaire in the 1870s.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="rouge_et_noir.htm">Rouge et Noir</a></p>
<p><a href="forty_devils.htm">Forty Devils</a></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="numeration.htm">Numeration</a></span></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Lady Jane

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Lady Jane</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="lady_cadogan.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="lady_of_the_manor.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Very Easy (&gt;99%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a>.  Move groups of cards if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Fill spaces with any card. <span class="f_Format3"> At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 3 cards at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  One <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Top card always available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Lady Jane was invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>.</p>
