<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck. Medium (66%).  Luck/Skill Balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>16 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles  - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Only one card at a time may be moved.  Spaces are filled automatically from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (left, face down) - automatically fills spaces in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">The idea is to get all of the cards in play by grouping cards in piles </span><a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a><span class="f_Format3">, which brings more cards into play via the empty spaces created.  The game is won if all cards are moved from the </span><a class="popuplink">stock</a><span class="f_Format3"> onto the </span><a class="popuplink">tableau</a><span class="f_Format3">.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>

<p><a href="bunker.htm">Bunker</a></p>
<p><a href="up_and_up.htm">Up and Up</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Swiss Patience

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">

<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Swiss Patience</span></p>
</td>

<span style="font-size: 9pt">

<a href="t.htm">Next</a>
</span>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p>1 Deck.  Medium (45%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Two to King to Ace.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>9 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Groups of cards in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a> may be moved as a unit.  Spaces may be filled only by Aces.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 to the 2nd, 3 to the 3rd, 4 to the 4th, 5 to the 5th, 4 to the 6th, 3 to the 7th, 2 to the 8th, and 1 to the 9th.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - deals 1 card to each <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile by clicking. No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">Swiss Patience has a pyramid shaped </span><a class="popuplink">tableau</a> like <span class="f_Format3"><a href="thieves_of_egypt.htm">Thieves of Egypt</a></span>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="thieves_of_egypt.htm">Thieves of Egypt</a></span></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Taj Mahal

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Taj Mahal</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="t.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="take_away.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Easy (75%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>7 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) -  build <a class="popuplink">down in any suit but the same</a>.  Groups of cards may be moved if they are in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in any suit but the same</a>.  When only one card remains in a <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile, the card becomes a "protected" card. Protected cards may only be moved to a <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> and no cards may be played upon them.   Protected cards remain protected until the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> is empty, then they become available for play on other <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles, and other cards may be played upon them.  Spaces may be filled by any card. At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 2 cards to the 2nd, and so on.  The top card is face up.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left) - turn over 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 12px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Taj Mahal is a cross between <a href="klondike.htm">Klondike</a> and <a href="indian_patience.htm">Indian Patience</a>.  It was invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>

<p><a href="klondike.htm">Klondike</a></p>
<p><a href="nunavut.htm">Nunavut</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (left) - No building. At the start of the game each pile contains 13 cards face up.  The top card of each pile is available.  Spaces are not filled.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>6 <a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles (right) - build from the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> <a class="popuplink">up or down regardless of suit</a>, <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> from Ace to King or King to Ace as necessary.     Once a card has been played to a <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile it cannot be moved.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Hard (15%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>6 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a>.  Groups of cards in sequence <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a> may be moved as a unit.  Spaces may be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (below <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span>. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">

</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Very Hard (&lt;0.1%).  All Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top) - build <a class="popuplink">up regardless of suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - cards are moved here from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  The top card of each pile is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.  Move cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> by clicking.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (face down) - deal 1 card to each <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> pile by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>This is an old and classic solitaire game.  It is a more difficult variation of <a href="auld_lang_syne.htm">Auld Lang Syne</a>.</p>

# Tarantella

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Tarantella</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="tam_o_shanter.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="tarantula.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Easy (75%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top right, starting with Aces) - build <a class="popuplink">up in color</a> from Ace to King, back to Ace to King again, until each pile contains 26 cards.  At the start of the game an Ace of each suit is dealt here.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - Build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>, <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> from Ace to King as necessary.  Groups of cards in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a> may be moved as a unit.  Spaces may be filled by any card or legal sequence of cards.  At the start of the game 5 cards are dealt to each pile, in the first and 10th piles, the top card is face up, in the 2nd and 9th piles 2 cards are face up, in the 3rd and 8th piles 3 cards are face up, in the 4th and 7th piles 4 cards are face up, and in the 5th and 6th piles all the cards are face up.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> - (left of <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span>.  At the start of the game 10 cards are dealt to this pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (left of <a class="popuplink">reserve</a>) - deals 1 card to each <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile by clicking.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Tarantella has some elements of <a href="klondike.htm">Klondike</a>, <a href="spider.htm">Spider</a>, and <a href="blondes_and_brunettes.htm">Blondes and Brunettes</a>.  It is named after an Italian dance that is supposed to be like being bitten by a Tarantula.  It was invented by <a href="thomas_warfield.htm">Thomas Warfield</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="klondike.htm">Klondike</a></p>
<p><a href="spider.htm">Spider</a></p>
<p><a href="blondes_and_brunettes.htm">Blondes and Brunettes</a></p>
<p><a href="pizzica.htm">Pizzica</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Tarantula

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Tarantula</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="tarantella.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="tasmanian_patience.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 1px;">2 Decks.  Medium (70%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To group all the cards in sets of 13 cards in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> from King to Ace within the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles - build <a class="popuplink">down regardless of suit</a>.  Groups of cards in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in color</a> may be moved as a unit.  A space can be filled by any card or legal group of cards.  At the start of the game 6 cards are dealt to the first 4 piles, and 5 cards to the remaining piles.  Only the top card is face up.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - deals 1 card to each <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile by clicking.  All <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles must have at least one card in them before you can do this.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>  The objective is to group all the cards in sets of 13 cards, from King to Ace <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Whenever such a group is formed in a pile, it is automatically removed from play.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 3px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>  When the stock is empty and you are unable to form the tableaus into sets of 13 cards of each suit, the game is lost.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Tarantula is a variation of the classic game <a href="spider.htm">Spider</a>.  The difference between <a href="spider.htm">Spider</a> and Tarantula is that in <a href="spider.htm">Spider</a> only groups of cards <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> may be moved, while in Tarantula any group in sequence <a class="popuplink">down in color</a> may be moved.  This makes Tarantula easier than <a href="spider.htm">Spider</a><span class="f_Format3">, but harder than <a href="black_widow.htm">Black Widow</a>.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="spider.htm">Spider</a></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="black_widow.htm">Black Widow</a></span> - <a href="spider_one_suit.htm">Spider One Suit</a></p>
<p><a href="spider_two_suits.htm">Spider Two Suits</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (50%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>7 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - Build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Groups of cards may be moved regardless of sequence. Spaces filled by Kings or groups of cards headed by a King. At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p>   </p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left) - turn over 3 cards at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile by clicking.  Unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Tasmanian Patience is <a href="australian_patience.htm">Australian Patience</a> with unlimited <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</p>

# Tens

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">

</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">

</span>
</td>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Hard (33%).  All Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To discard all the cards.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>13 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles - the top card is available for play.  Discard pairs of cards that have <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> that add to 10 (9-A, 8-2, 7-3, 6-4, 5-5). Tens, Jacks, Queens, and Kings are discarded in sets of the same rank (10-10-10-10, for example).   Spaces are automatically filled from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.   To discard a set of cards, move each card to the reserve pile in the lower left.  When a set is formed, or when cards of <a class="popuplink">rank</a> 9 or under add to 10, the cards are automatically discarded to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.   Pairs of cards that add to 10 can also be discarded by dropping one on the other if there are no cards in the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a>.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (face down, left) - fills spaces in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (far right)  - Where paired cards go out of play.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a><span class="f_Format3"> (lower left) - where sets of cards are formed.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Valid Discards</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>A-9, 2-8, 3-7, 4-6, 5-5, 10-10-10-10, Jack-Jack-Jack-Jack, Queen-Queen-Queen-Queen, King-King-King-King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (50%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To pair up all cards and move them out of play to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>11 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles - the top card of each pile is available.  Pair cards whose <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> add to 10 and remove Tens, Jacks, Queens, and Kings in pairs of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.  To remove a pair, pick up one card with the mouse and drop it on the other.  At the start of the game 5 cards are dealt face up to each of the first 8 piles, 4 cards are dealt face up to each of the remaining piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div><p style="text-indent: -24px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 36px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile (bottom of screen) - where paired cards go out of play.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3">Legal Pairs: Ace-9, 2-8, 3-7, 4-6, 5-5, 10-10, J-J, Q-Q, K-K.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>T<span class="f_Format3">ens Out is a variation of <a href="fourteen_out.htm">Fourteen Out</a>.</span></p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (80%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Only one card at a time may be moved (unless there is an empty <a class="popuplink">cell</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles, see the notes).  Spaces may be filled by any available card.  At the start of the game 5 cards are dealt face up to each pile (6 cards to the first two piles).</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>1 <a class="popuplink">cell</a> (top left) - storage locations for cards.  Only 1 card allowed in the <a class="popuplink">cell</a>. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">Groups of cards in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> can only be moved as a group if there is an empty </span><a class="popuplink">cell</a><span class="f_Format3"> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles available to store the cards individually.  The ability to move cards as a group is only a shortcut to moving the group one card at a time.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Ten By One is a variation of <a href="freecell.htm">FreeCell</a> with similarities to <a href="bastion.htm">Bastion</a> and <a href="fortress.htm">Fortress</a><span class="f_Format3">.</span></p>

<p><a href="fortress.htm">Fortress</a></p>
<p><a href="four_by_ten.htm">Four by Ten</a></p>
<p><a href="ten_by_six.htm">Ten by Six</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Ten by Six

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Ten by Six</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="ten_by_one.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="terrace.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck. Very Easy (99%).  Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Only one card at a time may be moved (unless there is an empty <a class="popuplink">cell</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles, see the notes).  Spaces may be filled by any available card.  At the start of the game 5 cards are dealt face up to each pile (6 cards to the first two piles).</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>6 <a class="popuplink">cells</a> (top left) - storage locations for cards.  Only 1 card allowed in each <a class="popuplink">cell</a>. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">Groups of cards in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> can only be moved as a group if there is an empty </span><a class="popuplink">cell</a><span class="f_Format3"> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles available to store the cards individually.  The ability to move cards as a group is only a shortcut to moving the group one card at a time.</span></td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Ten By Six is a variation of <a href="freecell.htm">FreeCell</a><span class="f_Format3">.</span></p>

# Terrace

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Terrace</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="ten_by_six.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="tetsol.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 1px;">2 Decks.  Hard (5%). Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (middle) - build <a class="popuplink">up by alternate color</a> from the <a class="popuplink">rank</a> of first card moved to the first pile, <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> from King to Ace as necessary, until each pile contains 13 cards. </td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>9 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Only the top card of each pile may be moved.  Spaces may be filled by a card from the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> only.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to the first 4 piles.  One of these cards is selected to be the <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> <a class="popuplink">base</a> card by moving it to the first <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> pile.  After a card is so moved 1 card is dealt face up to the remaining empty piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> (top) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> only.  At the start of the game 11 cards are dealt here.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over cards 1 at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>, except that when the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> is empty the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> may be turned over to form a new <a class="popuplink">stock</a> by clicking on the empty <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  Cards may then then be played to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span> until an unplayable card is reached (which ends the game).</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Tips</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>The restriction on play of cards in the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> makes this game difficult.  Note that it is extremely important which card you begin the game with by moving it to the first <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> pile.  Examine the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a> closely to make the best choice.  If there are several Sixes in the <a class="popuplink">reserve</a>, for example, you wouldn't want to pick a Six, or even a Five or Four as your <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> <a class="popuplink">base</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Terrace is also known as Queen of Italy. </p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>

<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="blondes_and_brunettes.htm">Blondes and Brunettes</a></span></p>
<p><a href="signora.htm">Signora</a></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a href="redheads.htm">Redheads</a></span></p>
<p><a href="bastille_day.htm">Bastille Day</a></p>
<p><a href="empress_of_italy.htm">Empress of Italy</a></p>


</td></tr></tbody></table>

# TetSol

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">TetSol</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="terrace.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="thatcher.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Hard (6%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To discard all the cards in pairs.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>15 (or 12 in 640x480 resolution) <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> Piles arranged in a 3x5 rectangle- discard pairs of cards that are one <a class="popuplink">rank</a> different from each other (Aces and Kings are considered consecutive) and are adjacent to each other, either side by side or diagonally.  Spaces are filled as follows: any card above a space slides down to fill the space, empty spaces at the top are filled by the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (Face down, middle) - automatically fills spaces at the top of the layout.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Discards (right) - all cards paired up and discarded from the layout are piled in 13 piles by <a class="popuplink">rank</a>, for easy counting of remaining cards.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Discard pairs of cards that are one <a class="popuplink">rank</a> different from each other (for example, a Two may be paired with either an Ace or a Three) and are adjacent to each other, either side by side or diagonally.  Kings may be paired with Aces.  To discard a pair, drop one of the cards on the other, or right-click on one of the cards.  Spaces are filled as follows: any card above a space slides down to fill the space, empty spaces at the top are filled by the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>.  This is the same way that pieces fall in the game Tetris.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Discarded pairs are moved to 13 piles to the right of the <a class="popuplink">stock</a>, grouped by <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.  This makes it easy to see what cards remain to be paired.  This is very important as it is very easy to make moves that will make it impossible to win.  For example, if you pair all the Tens with Nines and all the Queens with Kings, the Jacks have nowhere to go and can never be paired.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Tetsol is based on an earlier game of the same name in the 16-bit Pretty Good Solitaire.  That game had a different pairing method and was invented by Randy Rasa.  This game keeps the same <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> layout, but changes the pairing from cards that add to 13 to pairs of cards one <a class="popuplink">rank</a> different.  This makes for a more strategic game.</p>


</td></tr></tbody></table>

<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Thatcher</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="tetsol.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="the_bold.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Hard (15%).  Mostly Skill.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (middle) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Aces to Kings.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Groups of cards in descending sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a> may be moved as a unit.  Spaces are filled only by Kings or a group of cards headed by a King.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first and 10th piles, 2 cards to the 2nd and 9th piles, 3 cards to the 3rd and 8th piles, 4 cards to the 4th and 7th piles, and 5 cards to the 5th and 6th piles.  Only the top card is face up.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> (top) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> only. At the start of the game 6 cards with <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> of Six or less are dealt here.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - deals one card to each <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> pile that is not headed by a King by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p style="text-indent: -13px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 13px;"><span style="color: #000000;"> </span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>


<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>Thatcher is an easier version of <a href="prime_minister.htm">Prime Minister</a>.</p>

# The Bold

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">The Bold</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="thatcher.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="the_ides_of_march.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (20%).  Skill/Luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>4 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.  At the start of the game the Aces are dealt here.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>6 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (in box) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  The top card of each pile is available for play.  Only one card at a time may be moved.  Any card may be moved to a space.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (left, face down) - deal 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (below <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>The Bold is <a href="fortunes_favor.htm">Fortune's Favor</a> with only 6 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="fortunes_favor.htm">Fortune's Favor</a></p>
<p><a href="preference.htm">Preference</a></p>
<p><a href="lanes.htm">Lanes</a></p>
<p><a href="sleepers.htm">Sleepers</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# The Ides of March

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">The Ides of March</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="the_bold.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="the_plot.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Deck.  Medium (20%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To discard all the cards.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>13 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles - the top card is available for play.  Discard pairs of cards that have <a class="popuplink">ranks</a> that add to 15. Aces are discarded in pairs.  Spaces are automatically filled from the <a class="popuplink">stock</a> in the center 3 piles, otherwise in the outer 10 piles spaces are not filled.   At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt face up to 10 piles, 1 card is dealt face up to the center 3 piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (face down, left) - fills spaces in the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (lower left)  - Where paired cards go out of play.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Valid Discards</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>A-A, 2-K, 3-Q, 4-J, 5-10, 6-9, 7-8</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>The Ides of March is a variation of <a href="seventeens.htm">Seventeens</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="seventeens.htm">Seventeens</a></p>
<p><a href="friday.htm">Friday</a></p>
<p><a href="fifteen_rush.htm">Fifteen Rush</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# The Plot

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">The Plot</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="the_ides_of_march.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="the_spark.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Very Hard (1%).  Skill/luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a><span class="f_Format3">.</span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from the <a class="popuplink">rank</a> of first card dealt to the first pile, <a class="popuplink">wrapping</a> from King to Ace as necessary, until each pile contains 13 cards.  No cards can be played on the 2nd through 8th piles until all 13 cards have been played to the first pile.  The first pile is offset to the left of the other 7 piles.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>12 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (center) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a>.  Only one card at a time may be moved.  Spaces may be filled only from the <a class="popuplink">waste</a>.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to each pile.  Until the first <a class="popuplink">foundation</a><span class="f_Format3"> pile contains 13 cards, cards of the same </span><a class="popuplink">rank</a><span class="f_Format3"> as the first card of the first </span><a class="popuplink">foundation</a> pile cannot be built on other cards or built upon.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (bottom left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a>, by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (below <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Top card always available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> (top left, above <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - Top card always available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> only.  At the start of the game 13 cards are dealt here.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><span class="f_Format3">The Plot has three restrictions that make things difficult: 1) you cannot play any cards to the 2nd to 8th </span><a class="popuplink">foundation</a><span class="f_Format3"> piles until the first </span><a class="popuplink">foundation</a><span class="f_Format3"> pile contains all 13 cards.  The first pile is offset from the others to make it more visible.  2) cards in the </span><a class="popuplink">reserve</a> can be played only to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>, not to the <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>, and 3) until the first <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> pile contains 13 cards, you cannot build or build upon cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a> as the first card of the first <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>The Plot has similarities to <a href="canfield.htm">Canfield</a> and <a href="seven_devils.htm">Seven Devils</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="family_plot.htm">Family Plot</a></p>
<p><a href="single_plot.htm">Single Plot</a></p>
<p><a href="canfield.htm">Canfield</a></p>
<p><a href="seven_devils.htm">Seven Devils</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

# The Spark

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">The Spark</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="the_plot.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="the_wish.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Hard (33%).  Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">down in suit</a> from King to Ace.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>12 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> on right) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a>.  Only top card available for play.  Empty piles can be filled by any card.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt face up to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>, face down on left) - move 3 cards to each <a class="popuplink">waste</a> pile by clicking.  No <a class="popuplink">redeals</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>2 <a class="popuplink">waste</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span>.  At the start of the game 3 cards are dealt to each pile.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>Note that the building <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> and <span class="f_Format3"><a class="popuplink">tableau</a></span> is highly unusual.  Building in The Spark is backwards from most solitaire games.   Also, there are 2 waste piles rather than the usual one.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>The Spark is an upside down variation of <a href="busy_aces.htm">Busy Aces</a>. </p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Similar Games</span></p>
<p><a href="busy_aces.htm">Busy Aces</a></p>
<p><a href="single_spark.htm">Single Spark</a></p>
</td></tr></tbody></table>

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">1 Short Deck (32 cards).  Medium (25%). Mostly Luck.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">To discard all the cards in pairs of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles  - discard pairs of cards of the same <a class="popuplink">rank</a>.   The top card of each pile is available.   At the start of the game 4 cards are dealt to each pile, only the top card is face up.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (bottom) - Where paired cards go out of play.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Notes</span></p>
<p>The Wish uses a short deck of 32 cards, the 2's, 3's, 4's, 5's and 6's have been removed.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>
<p>The Wish is related to <a href="doublets.htm">Doublets</a>, <a href="nestor.htm">Nestor</a>, and other pair-discard games.</p>

</td></tr></tbody></table>

# Thieves of Egypt

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
<tbody><tr valign="middle">
<td>
<p class="p_Heading1"><span class="f_Heading1">Thieves of Egypt</span></p>
</td>
<td>
<span style="font-size: 9pt">
<a href="contents.htm">Top</a> 
<a href="the_wish.htm">Previous</a> 
<a href="thieves_rush.htm">Next</a>
</span>
</td>
</tr>
</tbody></table>
<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%"><tbody><tr valign="top"><td>
<p style="margin: 0px 17px 0px 0px;">2 Decks.  Medium (85%).  Skill/luck balanced.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Object</span></p>
<p>To move all the cards to the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>.</p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Layout</span></p>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>8 <a class="popuplink">foundation</a> piles (across top) - build <a class="popuplink">up in suit</a> from Ace to King.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td>10 <a class="popuplink">tableau</a> piles (below <a class="popuplink">foundations</a>) - build <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a>.  Groups of cards in sequence <a class="popuplink">down by alternate color</a> may be moved as a unit.  Spaces may be filled only by Kings.  At the start of the game 1 card is dealt to the first pile, 3 to the 2nd, 5 to the 3rd, 7 to the 4th, 9 to the 5th, 10 to the 6th, 8 to the 7th, 6 to the 8th, 4 to the 9th, and 2 to the 10th.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">stock</a> (top left, face down) - turn over 1 card at a time to the <a class="popuplink">waste</a> by clicking.  One <a class="popuplink">redeal</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<div style="text-align: left; text-indent: 0px; padding: 0px 0px 0px 0px; margin: 0px 0px 0px 0px;"><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="line-height: normal;"><tbody><tr style="vertical-align:baseline" valign="baseline"><td width="13"><span style="font-size: 10pt; font-family: 'Arial Unicode MS', 'Lucida Sans Unicode', 'Arial'; color: #000000;">•</span></td><td><a class="popuplink">waste</a> (next to <a class="popuplink">stock</a>) - top card is available for play on the <a class="popuplink">foundations</a> or <a class="popuplink">tableau</a>.</td></tr></tbody></table></div>
<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">Options</span></p>
<p><span class="f_Format3"><a>AutoPlay</a></span></p>

<p><span style="font-weight: bold;">History</span></p>

# Thieves Rush

<table cellpadding="5" cellspacing="0" width="100%">
